title: Subquadratic Kronecker Regression with Applications to Tensor Decomposition. (arXiv:2209.04876v2 [cs.DS] UPDATED)
abstract: Kronecker regression is a highly-structured least squares problem $\min_{\mathbf{x}} \lVert \mathbf{K}\mathbf{x} - \mathbf{b} \rVert_{2}^2$, where the design matrix $\mathbf{K} = \mathbf{A}^{(1)} \otimes \cdots \otimes \mathbf{A}^{(N)}$ is a Kronecker product of factor matrices. This regression problem arises in each step of the widely-used alternating least squares (ALS) algorithm for computing the Tucker decomposition of a tensor. We present the first subquadratic-time algorithm for solving Kronecker regression to a $(1+\varepsilon)$-approximation that avoids the exponential term $O(\varepsilon^{-N})$ in the running time. Our techniques combine leverage score sampling and iterative methods. By extending our approach to block-design matrices where one block is a Kronecker product, we also achieve subquadratic-time algorithms for (1) Kronecker ridge regression and (2) updating the factor matrices of a Tucker decomposition in ALS, which is not a pure Kronecker regression problem, thereb

translated_title: 子二次级Kronecker回归及其在张量分解中的应用
translated_abstract: Kronecker回归是一个高度结构化的最小二乘问题，即 $\min_{\mathbf{x}} \lVert \mathbf{K}\mathbf{x} - \mathbf{b} \rVert_{2}^2$，其中设计矩阵 $\mathbf{K} = \mathbf{A}^{(1)} \otimes \cdots \otimes \mathbf{A}^{(N)}$ 是因子矩阵的 Kronecker积。这个回归问题在广泛使用的交替最小二乘（ALS）算法的每一步中用于计算张量的 Tucker分解。我们提出了第一个解决Kronecker回归问题的子二次算法，它可以达到 $(1+\varepsilon)$ 的近似精度，而且避免了运行时间中的指数项 $O(\varepsilon^{-N})$。我们的技术结合了杠杆得分采样和迭代方法。通过将我们的方法扩展到其中一个块是一个 Kronecker积的块设计矩阵，我们还实现了用于 (1) Kronecker岭回归 和 (2) 在ALS中更新张量的 Tucker分解的因子矩阵的子二次时间算法，即不是一个纯Krconecker回归问题。
tldr: 本论文提出了第一个子二次算法，用于解决Kronecker回归问题。通过结合杠杆得分采样和迭代方法，可以避免运算时间中的指数项。此外，算法还可以扩展到 Kronecker岭回归和更新张量Tucker分解中的因子矩阵。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes the first subquadratic algorithm for solving the Kronecker regression problem, which avoids the exponential term in running time by combining leverage score sampling and iterative methods. Moreover, the algorithm can also be extended to Kronecker ridge regression and updating the factor matrices of a tensor Tucker decomposition.
